required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Wheat Sprouts Supplements on the Key Health Indicators of the Patients With Breast Cancer After Chemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Wheat Sprouts Supplements on the Key Health Indicators of the Patients With Breast Cancer After Chemotherapy

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
Beijing Shijitan Hospital, Capital Medical University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: To explore the effects of wheat sprouts supplements on the key health indicators of the patients with breast cancer after chemotherapy, Maiji tablets, a wheat sprouts supplement, were used to treat 26 patients during the progress of chemotherapy and nutritional status, immune function, quality of life were measured and evaluated. Through data analysis, we found that Maiji tablets may improve the symptoms of appetite loss, nausea and vomiting, and fatigue in patients with breast cancer during chemotherapy. Meanwhile it may help patients maintain weight, keep appetite and improve the food intake.

primary_outcome.description: Quality of life was measured by quality of life assessment form

clinical_study.condition: Nutritional Status, Immune Function, Quality of Life Uring the Progress of Chemotherapy

intervention.description: Maiji tablets, a wheat sprouts supplement, were used to treat 26 patients during the progress of chemotherapy

study_pop.textblock: patients diagnosed with breast cancer, receiving chemotherapy for the first time

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients diagnosed with breast cancer, receiving chemotherapy for the first time
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with severe liver or kidney disease or other infectious diseases

facility.name: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University
